metadata.title: CVE-2023-52678 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdkfd: Confirm list is non-empty before utilizing list_first_entry inkfd_topology.cBefore using list_first_entry, make sure to check that list is notempty, if list is empty return -ENODATA.Fixes the below:drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1347kfd_create_indirect_link_prop() warn: can 'gpu_link' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1428kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink1' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1433kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink2' even be NULL?

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
